alert.note: Alert for Lower Washington County (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 5:01PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Washington County through 530 PM MDT... At 500 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Washington, or 19 miles northeast of Virgin River Gorge, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... St George, Washington and Bloomington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 1 and 15. Utah Route 18 between mile markers 0 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
